attributes.action: on the conviction of every individual for any criminal offence impose a set of conditions that will reduce the likelihood of that person committing any crime at the end of their sentence.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Currently certain organisations can ask for an asbo on conviction or a court can decide to impose one.  What we are asking for is that every person convicted of any criminal offence is given a set of conditions the will help prevent them committing any offence.  These should not be restricted to just prohibitive conditions as is currently the case with asbos but should include additional conditions designed to to help a person with their employability, reducing there addictions, or managing their behaviour.

Breach of a condition should be punishable by imprisonment.

by way of an example a person convicted of residential burglary could be banned from certain areas, banned from entering any garden, or path leading to a home without prior agreement from the owner. not to carry crowbars screw drivers etc other than in his own home.  
To attend a drug treatment centre, to take up some form of education. To take up work in either a paid or voluntary capacity.
